Situation1: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Expectation2: Ensure client satisfaction and address any concerns or complaints professionally
Situation2: An easygoing regular politely asks for a tiny adjustment to their fringe.
Story: I glanced at the clock, my heart pounding. It was Saturday afternoon, the last weekend before Mia left for her new job in Berlin. We’d planned a special evening—her favorite restaurant, a walk by the river, just us. She’d been dropping hints all week about how much this time meant to her, and I promised I’d be there, no distractions. But as I was finishing up my last client, Mrs. Patel, she peered into the mirror and smiled apologetically. “Could you just trim a little more off the fringe? It’s almost perfect, but I trust you to get it right.” She was always so kind, and I knew how much she valued her appointments with me. My phone buzzed in my pocket—Mia, checking if I was on my way. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing down: the boyfriend who should never be late tonight, and the hairdresser who never rushes a client. My scissors hovered, my mind torn, as I tried to figure out who needed me more in this moment.
